p: Presenting symptoms were fever in 83% of patients and cough in 82%. Shortness of breath on admission was present in 31%. Other presenting symptoms in 4% or more of admitted patients included: myalgia, headache, confusion, sore throat and rhinorrhea. Only 1â€“2% of patients reported nausea and vomiting, or chest pain or diarrhea and 90% of patients had more than one sign or symptom present on admittance [ 12].
